summary: Home page responsive layout improvements: desktop banner background positioning, desktop search box width alignment, and mobile category list refinements (count placement, truncation, and link sizing) using Tailwind responsive utilities.
architectural_notes: Do not remove/modify/overwrite the existing :root CSS custom properties block in index.css; append any new CSS only below it, preserving variable names/values/structure exactly.
Prefer Tailwind CSS responsive utility classes (md/lg, max-md/sm) for these layout adjustments where possible.

existing_features.title: Adjust the home page hero banner background position ONLY on desktop (>=768px): apply `background-position-y: -170px` to the banner background image container, while preserving the current banner appearance on mobile (<768px). Use Tailwind responsive utilities / arbitrary properties if possible.

Expand the homepage search box container width on desktop so it aligns with the page container (max 1200px) and matches the width/edges of the category headers and product grid containers below. Preserve current search box width behavior on mobile.

Update the mobile category header layout in the homepage category sections: (a) move the product count to appear below the category name on mobile, left-aligned, in a smaller secondary style; (b) truncate long category names on mobile to prevent wrapping (use an ellipsis, target ~20â€“25 characters); (c) reduce the "Ver todos" link font size on mobile while keeping the desktop size unchanged. Use Tailwind responsive utilities (e.g., `md:` / `max-md:`) for layout and typography changes.

new_feature_requests.summary: Desktop-only home banner background-position-y set to -170px (>=768px), leaving mobile unchanged
Expand desktop search box width to full page container (max 1200px) and align with categories/product grid; keep mobile behavior unchanged
Mobile category layout updates: move product count below category name with smaller secondary style; truncate long names with ellipsis; reduce 'Ver todo' link font size on mobile; desktop unchanged

Preserve the existing `:root` CSS custom properties block in `frontend/src/index.css` exactly as-is (names, values, ordering, and structure). If any additional global CSS is required for these layout changes, append it only below the existing `:root` variables block without editing that block.
